Package main.models

Class Board

java.lang.Object
main.models.Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
Ilayout
public class Board extends Object implements Ilayout
Board class representing a chess board.
The context of this board is to represent a chess board where queens will be placed following the constraints of the n-queens puzzle.

  • Field Details

    • NUMBER_OF_DIAGONALS

      private static int NUMBER_OF_DIAGONALS
      Constant integer value representing the number of diagonals in a board.
      This value is calculated by the formula: 2 * n - 1;

    • n

      private final int n
      Integer value representing width and height of the board.

    • board

      private int[] board
      An integer array representing the board.
      Each index of the array represents a row, where each index value represents the column where a queen is placed.

    • numOfCollisions

      private final int numOfCollisions
      Integer value representing the number of collisions on the board.

    • frontSlashCollisions

      private int[] frontSlashCollisions
      Integer array representing diagonals with positive slope.

    • backSlashCollisions

      private int[] backSlashCollisions
      Integer array representing diagonals with negative slope.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(int n)
      Constructor class
      Parameters:
      n - Integer value representing width and height of the board.

    • Board

      public Board(int n, int[] board, int numOfCollisions)
      Constructor class.
      Only called to create boards from other previous boards.
      Parameters:
      n - Integer value representing width and height of the board.
      board - A board is passed as a param in order to facilitate board creation.
      This board is generated equal to the parent board.
      For more information on how this board is modified prior to generation, check children().
      For more information on what a board represents, check board.
      numOfCollisions - Integer value representing number of collisions.
      For more information on why this value is passed as a parameter, check children().

  • Method Details

    • fillBoard

      private void fillBoard()
      Method to initialize and fill a board.
      This method of initializing a board fills with various diagonals.
      For a board of size n = 6:
      - Q - - - -
      - - - Q - -
      - - - - - Q
      Q - - - - -
      - - Q - - -
      - - - - Q -

    • getNumOfCollisions

      private void swapColumns(int i, int j)
      Swap the columns of two queens.
      Parameters:

      j - Row of a queen.

    • updateSlashCollisions

      private int updateSlashCollisions(int i, int j)
      Calculates the difference of collisions before and after swapping two queens using the difference of diagonal collisions of the swap.
      Parameters:
      i - Row of a queen to simulate swap.
      j - Row of a queen to simulate swap.
      Returns:
      Integer representing the difference between the sum of the affected diagonal collisions before and after the swap.

    • getFrontSlashIndex

      private int getFrontSlashIndex(int row, int col)
      Calculate the index of the diagonal in frontSlashCollisions of a given queen.
      Parameters:
      row - Row of a queen.
      col - Column of a queen.
      Returns:
      Integer representing index of the queen's diagonal in frontSlashCollisions.

    • getBackSlashIndex

      col - Column of a queen.
      Returns:

    • checkDiagonalCollision

      private boolean checkDiagonalCollision(int q1Row, int q1Col, int Q2row, int Q2col)
      Check if two queens collide diagonally.
      Parameters:
      q1Row - Row of first queen.
      q1Col - Column of first queen.
      Q2row - Row of second queen.
      Q2col - Column of second queen.
      Returns:
      True if two queens collides, false otherwise.

    • calcSlope

      private int calcSlope(int q1Row, int q1Col, int Q2row, int Q2col)
      Calculates the slope between two queens.
      Parameters:
      q1Row - Row of first queen.
      q1Col - Column of first queen.
      Q2row - Row of second queen.
      Q2col - Column of second queen.
      Returns:
      Integer value representing the slope between two queens.

    • checkAxisCollision

      private boolean checkAxisCollision(int q1Row, int q1Col, int Q2row, int Q2col)
      Check if two queens collide horizontally or vertically.
      Parameters:
      q1Row - Row of first queen.
      q1Col - Column of first queen.
      Q2row - Row of second queen.
      Q2col - Column of second queen.
      Returns:
      True if they collide, false otherwise.

    • updatedDiagonalCollisions

      private void updatedDiagonalCollisions()
      Initialize and update the frontSlashCollisions and backSlashCollisions arrays.

    • collides

      private int collides()
      This method checks if a given queen tempQueenC attacks any other queen. It iterates every other queen checking for collisions.
      Returns:
      Integer value representing number of collisions.

    • children

      public List<Ilayout> children()
      Return all the children from the given board. Children are defined by the swap of two queens, but only a few are considered as a suitable child.
      A suitable child is one that has fewer collisions than its father.
      Specified by:
      children in interface Ilayout
      Returns:
      List<ILayout> containing all the children from a board.

    • isGoal

      public boolean isGoal()
      Specified by:
      isGoal in interface Ilayout
      Returns:
      true if the receiver equals the argument l;

      return false otherwise.

    • getG

      public int getG()
      Specified by:
      getG in interface Ilayout
      Returns:
      the cost for moving from the input config to the receiver.

    • isPossible

      public boolean isPossible()
      Check if, when the board has an even n, a queen is placed on the second row and column of the board.
      Specified by:
      isPossible in interface Ilayout
      Returns:
      True if valid, false otherwise.
